sentence.Network_en: He brought to the job not just considerable experience but passionate enthusiasm.
sentence.Network_cn: 他不仅给这一工作带来了不少经验，而且倾注了极大的热情。

sentence.Network_en: Shares and bonds can bring one quite a considerable additional income.
sentence.Network_cn: 股票和债券能给人带来不菲的额外收入。

sentence.Network_en: What'simpressed me has been his considerable firmness of purpose.
sentence.Network_cn: 令我印象深刻的是他对目标的坚定不移。

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English (in the sense 'capable of being considered'): from medieval Latin considerabilis 'worthy of consideration', from Latin considerare (see consider)

entry.def: Considerable means great in amount or degree.

example.ex: To be without Pearce would be a considerable blow...
example.tran: 失去皮尔斯将是一个巨大的打击。

example.ex: Doing it properly makes considerable demands on our time...
example.tran: 把这事做好要耗费我们相当多的时间。

means.word_mean: 1. large or relatively large in number or amount or extent or degree;

sentences.sentence: "the economy was a considerable issue in the campaign"
"spent a considerable amount of time on the problem"

auth_sentence.content: Spread across the whole country these are considerable numbers.
auth_sentence.res_content: Spread across the whole country these are considerable numbers.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Spread across the whole country these are considerable numbers.

auth_sentence.content: That is a considerable wedge of the energy pie.
auth_sentence.res_content: That is a considerable wedge of the energy pie.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: That is a considerable wedge of the energy pie.

auth_sentence.content: Making machine gears requires precision tools and considerable expertise.
auth_sentence.res_content: Making machine gears requires precision tools and considerable expertise.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Making machine gears requires precision tools and considerable expertise.

stems_affixes.value_cn: 值得考虑的, 相当可观的
stems_affixes.word_buile: consider[v.考虑,细想;体谅,顾及;认为,把…看作]+able能……的→adj.值得考虑的, 相当可观的
side旁边→n.边, 旁边, 面;adj.旁边的, 侧面的
in进入+side边→adj.&n.&adv.里面[的,地],内部[的,地]
out外面+side边→adj.&n.&adv.外面[的,地],外部[的,地]
considerable[adj.值得考虑的, 相当可观的]+ly表副词→considerably相当地
preside主持+ium地方或团体→n.主席团
reside[v.居住,驻扎;属于]+nce→n.住处,住宅
considerate[adj.考虑周到的,体谅的]+ion表名词→consideration体谅, 考虑
side旁边→n.边, 旁边, 面;adj.旁边的, 侧面的
side旁边+way路→n.小路, 小巷,人行道
super在……上面+sede=side坐→坐上去→淘汰[以前的东西]

Sentence.sentence: It is important that we be mindful of the earth, the planet out of which we are born and by which we are nourished, guided, healed-the planet, however, which we have abused to a considerable degree in these past two centuries of industrial exploitation.
There is considerable and justified concern that the United States is falling behind much of the rest of the developed world in these essential disciplines.

sentences.en: It is a considerable sum of money.
sentences.cn: 那是一笔数量可观的钱。

sentences.en: They have given the plan considerable attention.
sentences.cn: 他们已经给予这个计划以相当多的注意。

jushi.english: A considerable number of people object to the government's attitude to immigration.
jushi.chinese: 相当多的人反对政府对待移民问题的态度。

jushi.english: The mayor is a considerable citizen.
jushi.chinese: 这位市长是位值得尊敬的公民。

jushi.english: It is a considerable sum of money.
jushi.chinese: 那是一笔数量可观的钱。
